info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued November 07 at 3:48AM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: .DISCUSSION... Light winds will begin the day, but will see increasing southeast winds to develop through the late morning/afternoon, with gusts as high as 30 to 40 mph expected through the Missouri and James River Valleys by afternoon. Despite a band of clouds lifting across the region this morning, should see increasing sunshine through the afternoon. The gusty winds will be accompanied by temperatures warming through the 40s, with dew points near to below 10 degrees. This will yield minimum humidity levels of 18 to 28 percent, lowest in the area of strongest winds west of the James River this afternoon. Will maintain the Red Flag Warning for areas west of a line from Howard to Parker to Vermillion during the afternoon hours, though eastern portions of the warning may be a bit more marginal on reaching criteria, depending on how quickly the winds increase this afternoon. Will see many windy days throughout the week ahead, but a strong storm system will bring increasing humidity to the region Tuesday and Wednesday, with a good chance for widespread rain and even snow as much colder air pushes into the region late this week and into the weekend. Postpone burning due to the very high or extreme fire danger. Grass fires can move very quickly. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly, becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. OUTLOOK FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON...The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the high category. The grassland fire danger product reflects fire danger for native grasses. It is not intended for cured agricultural crops, nor will it reflect conditions in road ditches which have been mowed.
